msContents.summary:
Collection of cookery receipts, with some medical and veterinary receipts: by various hands.

Most of the medical and veterinary receipts are at the end of the volume.

Dr Yardly directions for the Piles wth a Loosness. Mrs. Gees diat drinke for wind. Mrs Gees diat drink for the Stone in the Kidneys. Mrs Chilcorks Recaipt for the Ricketts A drink and Pouder. The Drink. The Pouder

For the small pox being struck in or any destemper that suddenly Infects the blould, or for ye biting of a mad dog. Mrs Lowards medicine for the Headach. Dr Boys his Receipt for ye Cialybat Wine. Dr Boys Bitter Draught. Dr. Boys Glyster for the Stone Colick
To Make Ratafia. An Excellent Purge for ye Head by doctor Carters Direccons. For a blow on the Eye. A snail watter for a Consumption. A powder for the Piles
To drye up the small pox. To Make Usquebaugh. To Make Hirapichra
cont. from folio 89, To Make ye searecloth for ye Breast. An Oyntment for ye Small Pox. My Lady Sydenhams Oyntment for ye Small pox. To Dry up the Small Pox

cont. from folio 90, A Cordiall water for any infectious disease an ye Plague pestilence burneing feaver Pox & to remove any offensive water from ye stomacke especially after A surfeit good to be given to women in passions of the Mother & to Children in Convulsion fitts it is usually given warme to Comfort wth all. Doctor Dentons Vomitt. To Make A Poultice for ye Breast. To Make ye searecloth for ye Breast, cont. on folio 88

cont. from folio 91,The Greene oyntmt for ye spleen Aches bruises straines swellings or palseys Comforting of ye sinewes & bones. A seare Cloth. For A Consumpion Cough. To make Lucke tellub Balsame. A Cordiall water for any infectious disease an ye Plague pestilence burneing feaver Pox & to remove any offensive water from ye stomacke especially after A surfeit good to be given to women in passions of the Mother & to Children in Convulsion fitts it is usually given warme to Comfort wth all, cont. on folio 89

To Black frames or any other thing in Oyle to be shineing Color. To fetch out staines out of Linen. A medicine for a quinsey an imposthume in the throat or Alemonds. A Cure for any Canker or Mislity in ye mouth. The Greene oyntmt for ye spleen Aches bruises straines swellings or palseys Comforting of ye sinewes & bones, cont. on folio 91

cont. from folio 93, To make Drinke for ye Kings Evill. For ye Itch. A Salve good to heale any soare cutt or Bruise. It is good for all Burne alsoe. For A Dropsie or Festulowe. For the scurvy & paine in ye Leggs. An approved receipt ag ye stone. Glew for Black Frames

cont. from folio 94, To make Ballis Oyle. Glew for Black Frames. Oyle of Earthwormes & Swallowes. A Receipt for ye Pleurisie or any pains ye side. To make the bitter Drinke. To make Liquid Laudanum. To make Drinke for ye Kings Evill, cont. on folio 92

cont. from folio 95, The Receipt of ye Gout Water. To make Cherry Water. To make Cinamond Water. An approved Frownse Water for a sore mouth or any Kind of Wound or Canker in ye mouth. An Excellent salve wch is good to use wth ye Frownse water if it bee a great Wound or else ye water will cure of itt Selfe. Oyle of Swallows to releive straynings of sinews & old Bruises. To make Ballis Oyle, cont. on folio 93
cont. from folio 96, To make Orange Water. Palsie Water. A Cordiall Water. The Receipt of ye Gout Water, cont. on folio 94

cont. from folio 97, For the Piles. The Receipt of ye Gout Water. The Dutches of Portsmouth's Water. Milke Surfeit Water. To make Poppy Water. Plain Mint Water. To Distill speere Mint Water. To make Angelico Water. To make Orange Water, cont. on folio 95

A Gentle Purge for A man. An Ointment good for all Burnes & Scalds. A Exsent Remedy for a bruise or straine. Elixir Salutcus for Cholick Gravell in ye Kidneys griping of ye Gutts & Colds. For the Piles, cont. on folio 96

layoutDesc.layout: Pp. 1-10, 27/28, 33-36, 57/58 are wanting. P. 196 is doubled in the pagination.

bibl.title: Catalogue of Western Manuscripts on Medicine and Science in the Wellcome Historical Medical Library
bibl.author: S. A. J. Moorat
bibl.publisher: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine

surrogates.bibl: In addition, a microfilm copy is held as AMS/MF/225.
